Officer Dean saw Jefferson through a bedroom window, open fire, and killed her, he was never attacked.  This is the victim of that shooting, Tatiana Jefferson, a pre-med graduate of Xavier University and sold equipment for the pharmaceutical industry.  Attorney Lee Merritt set up a GoFundMe page in her honor.  By mid-afternoon today, Monday, it was about $30,000 away from making a $200,000 goal.  The police chief there in Fort Worth called the shooting senseless and expressed sympathy, apologies, condolence and prayers from his entire department to the family of the victim.  Then he demanded action.

I assure you as chief of this department, I share those concerns and I demand a thorough, transparent and speedy investigation.  This will not be an opportunity for us to make excuses, but rather to investigate this case to the fullest.  To provide the justice we all seek for Tatiana, the officer who shot Tatiana was served his written administrative complaint on Sunday. I personally checked on the progress of that case repeatedly, and I anticipate a substantial update to provide you no later than tomorrow. Retired LAPD Sergeant Cheryl Dorsey is with us tonight.  So Cheryl, the chief there listed a series of swift actions.  It might sound to many observers like he's throwing the book at the officer who fired his weapon.  What's your assessment?
